pageProps.title: Vim tip: persistent undo
pageProps.description: Usually, when you open a file in your editor, make some changes, save and close, you lose the ability to <kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Z</kbd>. Vim has a built in mechanism to persist changes made to files on disk. This may not sound that exciting, but what if your editor crashes while you have a set of changes you may want to revert stored?
